Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the increase in the rainy day fund by stating it went from 89 cents to $240 million, when in reality it went from 89 cents to $246.9 million.
Understate: The claim understates the current balance of the rainy day fund by rounding it to $240 million instead of the actual balance of $246.9 million.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any specific details or evidence to support the increase in the rainy day fund.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the increase in the rainy day fund is solely attributed to the actions of Gov. John Kasich, without considering other factors or contributors.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the increase in the rainy day fund, such as economic factors or policies implemented by previous administrations.
